Prompts.title: Introduction to the C Language
Prompts.prompt: Describe the origins of C, its historical importance, and why it remains relevant in software development. Limit to 150-200 words. Include links to resources about its evolution and significant milestones.

Prompts.title: Features of the C Programming Language
Prompts.prompt: List the key features of C (like portability, efficiency, and modularity) and explain how each contributes to its flexibility and performance. Limit to 100-150 words. Add links to resources for further info.

Prompts.title: Understanding the C Language Standards
Prompts.prompt: Explain the evolution of C standards (C89, C99, C11, etc.) and how each version has added new capabilities. Limit to 150-200 words and include links to resources on C language standards.

Prompts.title: Setting Up a C Development Environment
Prompts.prompt: Provide a guide for setting up a development environment for C across different platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux). Mention common tools, compilers, and IDEs. Limit to 150-200 words and include installation links.

Prompts.title: Writing and Running a Basic C Program
Prompts.prompt: Guide readers on writing and executing a basic C program. Include steps for code structure, compiling, and running the code on different platforms. Limit to 100-150 words.

Prompts.title: Understanding C Comments
Prompts.prompt: Explain the purpose of comments in C and demonstrate the correct syntax for single-line and multi-line comments. Limit to 100-150 words and include tips on writing effective comments.

Prompts.title: Conclusion!
Prompts.prompt:
### Conclusion Write an engaging and inviting conclusion statement that encourages readers to leave their comments, feedback, or suggestions in the comments section. Use a friendly tone with emojis. Format the response with the following styled title:

Conclusion

Make sure the generated text follows this header and fits well with a blog's ending.
